FacilityStr1: 1/4 mile south of town - East of Hw

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies: The owners, management and employees
of the Farmers Union Oil of Napoleon are committed to providing a safe workplace free of accidental releases of
anhydrous ammonia. Health, safety and enviromental compliance are a fundamental part of every employee's
job. It is facility policy to adhere to applicable Federal, State and Local laws and to implement appropriate
controls to prevent accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If  an accidental release were to occur, the
facility would respond in accordance with it's Emergeny Response Plan and is prepared to work with the local
fire department, the Local Emergency Planning Committee and other authorities to control and mitigate the 
release and minimize the impact of the release to employees, the enviroment and the general public.

The accidental release prevention program. The facility complies with the EPA,s accidental release prevention
requirements and applicable State and local codes and regulations.

The five year accident history.
There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past 5 years that have caused any
deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility. Nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite
deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or enviromental damage.

The emergency response program. The facility has a written emergency response action plan, provided local
authorities the plan and SARA Title III, and includes pre emergency planning and employee training.

Planned changes to improve safety.
Safety improvement is an ongoing process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to asses the 
maintenance of sate conditions. There are 0 additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations
for implementation at this time.
